options.title: -0, --null
options.description: end each output line with NUL, not newline

options.title: -0, --null
options.description: end each output line with NUL, not newline

options.title: -a, --all
options.description: write counts for all files, not just directories

options.title: -a, --all
options.description: write counts for all files, not just directories

options.title: --apparent-size
options.description:
print apparent sizes rather than device usage; although the apparent size
      is usually smaller, it may be larger due to holes in ('sparse') files,
      internal fragmentation, indirect blocks, and the like

options.title: -B, --block-size=SIZE
options.description:
scale sizes by SIZE before printing them; e.g., '-BM' prints sizes in
      units of 1,048,576 bytes; see SIZE format below

options.title: -B, --block-size=SIZE
options.description:
scale sizes by SIZE before printing them; e.g., '-BM' prints sizes in
      units of 1,048,576 bytes; see SIZE format below

options.title: -b, --bytes
options.description: equivalent to '--apparent-size --block-size=1'

options.title: -b, --bytes
options.description: equivalent to '--apparent-size --block-size=1'

options.title: -c, --total
options.description: produce a grand total

options.title: -c, --total
options.description: produce a grand total

options.title: -D, --dereference-args
options.description: dereference only symlinks that are listed on the command line

options.title: -D, --dereference-args
options.description: dereference only symlinks that are listed on the command line

options.title: -d, --max-depth=N
-d, --max-depth=N
--files0-from=F
options.description:
summarize device usage of the NUL-terminated file names specified in file
      F; if F is -, then read names from standard input

options.title: -H
options.description: equivalent to --dereference-args (-D)

options.title: -h, --human-readable
options.description: print sizes in human readable format (e.g., 1K 234M 2G)

options.title: -h, --human-readable
options.description: print sizes in human readable format (e.g., 1K 234M 2G)

options.title: --inodes
options.description: list inode usage information instead of block usage

options.title: -k
options.description: like --block-size=1K

options.title: -L, --dereference
options.description: dereference all symbolic links

options.title: -L, --dereference
options.description: dereference all symbolic links

options.title: -l, --count-links
options.description: count sizes many times if hard linked

options.title: -l, --count-links
options.description: count sizes many times if hard linked

options.title: -m
options.description: like --block-size=1M

options.title: -P, --no-dereference
options.description: don't follow any symbolic links (this is the default)

options.title: -P, --no-dereference
options.description: don't follow any symbolic links (this is the default)

options.title: -S, --separate-dirs
options.description: for directories do not include size of subdirectories

options.title: -S, --separate-dirs
options.description: for directories do not include size of subdirectories

options.title: --si
options.description: like -h, but use powers of 1000 not 1024

options.title: -s, --summarize
options.description: display only a total for each argument

options.title: -s, --summarize
options.description: display only a total for each argument

options.title: -t, --threshold=SIZE
options.description:
exclude entries smaller than SIZE if positive, or entries greater than
      SIZE if negative

options.title: -t, --threshold=SIZE
options.description:
exclude entries smaller than SIZE if positive, or entries greater than
      SIZE if negative

options.title: --time
options.description:
show time of the last modification of any file in the directory, or any of
      its subdirectories

options.title: --time-style=STYLE
options.description:
show times using STYLE, which can be: full-iso, long-iso, iso, or +FORMAT;
      FORMAT is interpreted like in 'date'

options.title: -X, --exclude-from=FILE
options.description: exclude files that match any pattern in FILE

options.title: -X, --exclude-from=FILE
options.description: exclude files that match any pattern in FILE

options.title: --exclude=PATTERN
options.description: exclude files that match PATTERN

options.title: -x, --one-file-system
options.description: skip directories on different file systems

options.title: -x, --one-file-system
options.description: skip directories on different file systems

options.title: --help
options.description: display this help and exit

options.title: --version
options.description: output version information and exit
